casebody.data:
Chambers vs. Kingsberry; Skrine, for use, vs. Lewis. To render a promissory note a sealed instrument, it should be so recited in the body of the note. The mere addition of a seal after the signature is not sufficient. Code, §2915. Speer, Justice.

(a.) A' note in the usual form, but with a seal added after the signature, will be barred after six years'from maturity. Code, §2917.
